intro: Spermacoce verbenoides, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false vervain, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pale blue flowers clustered in umbels. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and it produces small, round, dark blue berries that contain the seeds. Spermacoce verbenoides is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain areas. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
